[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Cafeteria Ordering System (COS) defines functional and non-functional requirements for secure transactions, efficient order processing, and controlled user access within corporate environments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: COS supports secure authentication, menu management, order transactions, and web-based interactions for cafeteria services.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: COS integrates with corporate authentication systems, encrypted payment gateways, and secure transaction logging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: COS provides a web-based UI optimized for menu browsing, order placement, and administrative controls.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: COS runs on cloud-hosted web servers, accessible via corporate and authorized external networks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: COS uses React.js for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, PostgreSQL for data storage, and Redis for caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: COS enforces TLS 1.3 encryption and OAuth 2.0 authentication for secure data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: COS optimizes query execution and concurrent order processing for minimal latency.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: COS ensures real-time menu updates, secure order processing, and controlled user authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: COS supports cross-browser functionality and mobile accessibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: COS links to authentication, transaction processing, and compliance monitoring services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: COS supports user authentication, menu browsing, order placement, and secure payment processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: COS is designed for cafeteria patrons, staff, and corporate employees with authorized system access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: COS requires corporate authentication, stable network connectivity, and compliance with security policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: COS relies on corporate authentication, encrypted transaction protocols, and real-time data synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall authenticate users via corporate login and enforce session-based authorization controls.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall encrypt all financial and personally identifiable information using TLS 1.3 security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall require authentication for all transactions and restrict administrative actions to authorized personnel (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to browse menus, place orders, and track transaction history (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall ensure fully responsive web pages with structured navigation for ease of use.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process and display query results within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall display transaction confirmation messages within 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user credentials, menu data, and order history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support internal corporate intranet access and external access for authorized users.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall enforce encrypted transactions for financial and personal data (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain high availability, ensuring real-time order processing and transaction monitoring.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, transaction security, and response times shall be validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User documentation, API references, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Industry best practices for secure transactions, access control, and TLS security standards.
